name: textile production, cotton, air jet loom weaving | textile, woven cotton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19648/documentation

Inventory refers to the weaving of 1 kg  yarn (450 GSM) into textile, the production of the yarn itself is not included.;The dataset covers wrap beaming, sizing, knotting and drawing, weaving and inspection of woven textile. The energy use is in the lower range when compared to average data.;Weaving is a process of interlacement of two sets of threads, called "wrap" and "weft" yarns, to produce the fabric of desired quality. The process starts with warping, where yarns are laid on warp beam, in preparation of weaving. These yarns are sized with maize starch. Steam for starch preparation is supplied by combustion of rice husk. The weaving is done on Airjet looms. and electricity consumption of Air compressor and utilities has been included. ;The main inputs for weaving process are cotton yarn, electricity, lubricating oil for machinery, water and sizing solution (maize starch, binder and softener). Diesel is also used for power backup on need basis. It is important to note here that the energy data is calculated based on available secondary data from literature for energy consumption of each machine. ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - weaving, cotton, IN, 2015 - 2016 (3145bd1d-b399-42ea-94db-1897cafeb3e2)]

The activity starts with warping and sizing of cotton yarn.

This process ends with conversion of cotton yarn at weaving plant to 1 kg of woven fabric.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1312:Weaving of textiles

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average based on inputs from manufacturer in Haryana North India.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The following processes are used to convert cotton yarn to woven fabric: Warping, sizing and weaving. The weaving is done on Airjet looms. Air compressor and utilities energy consumption has been included. The fabric is then sent for further processing such as bleaching, mercerising and dyeing etc.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Industry data. Representative mills in Haryana (North India) was chosen to provide data based on its technical representativeness of the current state of business and their willingness to participate.
